experience: You and Patti both know Eric Olsen, Lynda Bishop, and 4 others
A Simple Exercise Based on Buddhist Wisdom Can Help You Cultivate Compassion

Frank Lloyd Wright called the Kiva at Taliesin West a “desert playhouse.” He described it as “solid masonry inside and outside, with a sunken fireplace and an outside hangar for our cinema to peep in through the thick stone wall, arrangements for feasting and music. A triumph of imagination by way of simple form and limited space in the heart of a great cubical masonry block.” Info taken from the Frank Lloyd Wright Foundation. Wright’s “desert masonry” is really showcased here more then any other location at Taliesin West (in my humble opinion)
Why Adaptive Reuse and Infill Projects Are Worth the Effort

Plan, manage and execute all GI events, and design event policies and procedures for the organization. Act as a liaison between the development and communications teams, assist in designing collateral and communications.Serve as high level support for the President, COO and CFO; and provide strategic support to the development team.Previously managed Ronald Reagan Fellows Intern Program, from job posting to daily management of the team and various programs.In the absence of an office manager, oversee all office operations and daily logistics, including; new employee onboarding, various HR functions, managing vendor relationships, ensure all teams have the tools necessary to accomplish the mission.Assisted in the coordination of two office relocations - the first to a temporary space during the main office renovation, and the second, a return to the main office upon completion of the renovation.

Managed all aspects of LDC projects including project initiation and oversight, setting deadlines and monitoring status, assigning responsibilities, and monitoring and summarizing progress of each project. Supported the LDC Executive Director and leadership in all areas of the organization, including but not limited to travel management, accounting, and general administrative work.Produced reports for leadership and partners. Enhanced infrastructure through the development of policies, procedures and reporting tools.  Prepared and submitted grant applications, as well as compiled prospect research reports regarding future grant opportunities.  Produced semi-annual Board Meetings and Convenings with national thought leaders, media executives, top academic leaders and C-Suite executives from across the country.Served as partner liaison to all organizational partners, incl. 20th Century Fox, NBCUniversal, The Partnership for a New American Economy, the American Film Institute (AFI) and several leading universities.

Oversaw annual giving and membership activities for the Foundation. Managed and coordinated logistics for constituent and prospect solicitation and communication. Created criteria for coding, tracking, scheduling and segmentation of constituents and external prospects. Established strategy for solicitation of annual gifts under $10,000 from individuals, corporations and foundations in conjunction with the Vice President for Development and Communication, including the development of proposals and formulation of grant applications. Successful grant applications include federal grants awarded by the Institute of Museum and Library Services (IMLS) and the National Arts Endowment (NEA). Processed gifts received by the Foundation and ensured that they are properly coded according to established guidelines and promptly entered into the donor database. Collaborated with the Finance department to ensure the accurate reconciliation of all gift reports. Formulated and distributed donor acknowledgment letters in a timely manner.Organized and executed development-related events at Taliesin West and attend community events as a representative of the Foundation. Prepared various reports for the Vice President daily, weekly and as needed. Supervised the membership specialist, membership sales personnel and volunteers who perform membership-related duties.

Streamlined the National Board Giving Program, and served as staff lead to the National Board Alumni program and related activities. Coordinated mailings and special projects for high-level donors and prospects and generated annual investment reports and major gift proposals. Delivered weekly donor communication updates to chapter CEOs and created a formalized structure for VIP communication from the National President and CEO. Planned donor-related annual events at the National Conference, including a recognition luncheon and the execution of a surprise “wish reveal”.Improved the communication strategy for Foundation endowment donors and managed personalized micro-sites. Established and implemented a program for the reinvestment of endowment funds into the chapters, including the management of a quarterly application process open to 62 chapters across the country, distribution of application summary reports to endowment donors and ultimately the distribution of over $400,000 back to the chapters.

Developed new programming and volunteer opportunities for special interest groups and recruited student and alumni participants. Advised student alumni groups and introduced students to networking opportunities. Acted as liaison to Student Affairs, Student Government, the communications department, Barry Magazine and The Buccaneer Student Newspaper to maintain open communication and seek out collaborative projects. Implemented new student events including the Dinner for 10 BUCS student and alumni networking dinner, the Pancake-a-Palooza hosted by the University President and senior leadership team, and the Sync or Swim synchronized swimming contest honoring the University’s past. Planned local and regional networking events including, the Distinguished Alumni Awards, Alumni Reunion Weekend and the Alumni Board of Directors Annual Meeting. Established multi-channel e-communications strategy for the office with the University marketing team. Streamlined the alumni scholarship program, led the scholarship committee and collaborated with the Office of Financial Aid to administer the funds to the alumni scholarship recipients. Chosen by the President to serve on University-wide committees including, Mission Integration Council and the Founders’ Week Committee.

Served as an integral part of the fundraising team for the 2008 "An Affair of the Arts" gala for National Foundation for Advancement of the Arts, under Elysze Held. Noted guests for the 2008 gala were - Lin Arison, Adrienne Arsht, Frank Gehry, Chairs Armando & Margarita Codina, Chairman Billy Cypress of the Miccosukee Tribe of Indians of Florida, Ambassador Paul Cejas and Ginny Mancini (wife of Henry Mancini).
Manager of Special Events & Volunteer Relations

Charged with raising over $400,000 annually, primarily through events. Facilitated large non-fundraising, special events. Events included the annual father/daughter dinner, which draws more than 700 guests, and the employee appreciation dinner, a formal event for over 200 staff members. Executed numerous smaller events, managed all volunteer activities and programming including, the Mothers' and Fathers' Clubs and associated committees. Produced and distributed all communications from the Office of Special Events and Volunteer Relations.
Capital Enhancement, LLC - Talent for United States Senate

Led statewide fundraising efforts as part of a two-person team for the re-election campaign of United States Senator Jim Talent. Selected as the advance team lead for a private event with President George W. Bush. Negotiated strategy for the event with representatives from the Secret Service, the White House, the campaign, Senator Talent’s Washington office and the event hosts. Coordinated logistics for events with First Lady Laura Bush, New York City Mayor Rudy Giuliani, White House Press Secretary Tony Snow, and many others. Over the course of the campaign, over $14 million was raised.

Director of Sales / Marketing at Investitute
April 18, 2010, Patti worked with Steve in the same group

Patti is an amazing individual who takes a deeply vested interest in everyone that she has the opportunity to work with.  As an Alumni Ambassador I was blessed to be under Patti's supervision.  She always had a positive attitude and carried herself in a professional manner.  Whenever I was in need of assistance she never waited for me to ask for help before she offered solutions.  Without the influence of individuals like Patti during my tenure at Barry I would not have enjoyed the experiece as much nor gained so much knowlege.  She without doubt has had a direct influence on the increasing retention rate of Barry students.Patti has a strong ability to serve as a mentor to her students  and upbuiling them to be future leaders in our community.  Patti encourages others to set goals high yet attainable and gives as much assistance to ensuring that these goals are met.  Patti is a true asset to the Barry community and would serve as an empowering individual to any organizations success.

He is hardworking and dedicated and any organization would be lucky to count him as one of their own.
